description.title: lessons learnt
description.text:
This Professional Certificate, encompassing a 5-course series, has empowered me as an administrator to master the foundational aspects of establishing and managing Google Workspace for my organization. Throughout the series, I set up a new Google Workspace account, explored provisioning options, managed users, understood organizational structures, and configured core services to meet specific organizational needs.

The applied learning project was a hands-on experience where I created a Google Workspace account. Through a series of exercises, I built an organizational structure, added users, and became familiar with the admin console and administrator features. This involved configuring groups, calendar resources, and implementing core services like Gmail and Calendar for different organizational segments.

In subsequent courses, I delved into user and application security, implementing best practices to protect both users and data. I explored Single Sign-On options and used tools to identify security events and mitigate potential problems. Email compliance and security measures were covered, including configuring email compliance, protecting against spam, spoofing, phishing, and malware attacks, and exploring mail routing options.

The series concluded with a focus on deploying Google Workspace best practices. I gained an understanding of the trial account setup process, providing credit card details for the free trial. I was required to purchase or use an existing domain for Google Workspace (not included in the trial) and utilize the Chrome web browser for an optimal learning experience. Overall, this certification has equipped me with the knowledge and skills needed for successful Google Workspace deployment, adhering to best practices in administration, security, and compliance.

description.title: lessons learnt
description.text: In this course, I acquired a comprehensive set of skills essential for a UX designer. I learned to follow the design process, beginning with empathizing with users, defining pain points, ideating solutions, and creating wireframes and prototypes. The course covered the basics of UX research, including planning studies, conducting interviews and usability studies, and synthesizing research results. Additionally, foundational UX concepts such as user-centered design, accessibility, and equity-focused design were explored. A practical aspect involved creating a professional UX portfolio showcasing three end-to-end projects: a mobile app, a responsive website, and a cross-platform experience. This holistic learning experience equipped me with the skills and knowledge needed for effective UX design, from research and ideation to prototyping and portfolio creation.

description.title: lessons learnt
description.text:
Embarking on the comprehensive Rust Specialization offered by Coursera in collaboration with Duke University has been a transformative journey for me as a software engineer. This five-course series, emanating from a top-tier Data Science and AI program, has provided me with practical skills to effectively harness Rust's speed, safety, and versatility in robust systems programming.

From laying the foundation with foundational syntax to delving into advanced machine learning integrations, the specialization has been a hands-on experience. With over 20 coding projects woven into the curriculum, I've had the opportunity to apply my Rust skills to real-world scenarios. Projects like building a Rust chatbot, containerizing a web service, developing a Linux automation script, and optimizing a machine learning pipeline have not only enriched my understanding but have also equipped me with portfolio-ready experience.

The real-world challenges presented in the courses, such as constructing a database migration tool or optimizing an ML pipeline, have stretched my capabilities and deepened my expertise. This specialization has gone beyond theoretical knowledge, emphasizing applied learning to ensure that I not only comprehend Rust's intricacies but can also adeptly navigate real-world systems programming problems.

As I near the completion of this specialization, I find myself armed with portfolio-ready Rust abilities, poised to explore roles such as Platform Engineer, MLOps Engineer, Data Engineer, Embedded Engineer, or Backend Developer. The meticulous design of the specialization, combined with the hands-on coding projects, has been instrumental in shaping me into a proficient Rust programmer, ready to tackle complex challenges in the field of systems programming.
